nodes.documentation: @title Implementation of ERC1400 (Subset of ERC1400 https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/1411)
nodes.name: LoanCoin

nodes.documentation:
@dev Get the number of decimals of the token.
@return The number of decimals of the token. For retrocompatibility, decimals are forced to 18 in ERC1400.
nodes.name: decimals

nodes.documentation: @title Implementation of ERC1400 (Subset of ERC1400 https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/1411)
nodes.name: LoanCoin

nodes.documentation:
@dev Get the number of decimals of the token.
@return The number of decimals of the token. For retrocompatibility, decimals are forced to 18 in ERC1400.
nodes.name: decimals

nodes.documentation: @dev Total number of tokens in existence
nodes.name: totalSupply
balanceOf
transfer

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params.owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params.spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

returns._0: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of 'msg.sender'.

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

returns._0: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.owner: The address to query the balance of.

returns._0: An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

controllerRedeem(address,uint256,bytes,b.details: This function can only be executed by the `controller` address.

params._data: data to validate the transfer. (It is not used in this reference implementation because use of `_data` parameter is implementation specific).
params._operatorData: data attached to the transfer by controller to emit in event. (It is more like a reason string for calling this function (aka force transfer) which provides the transparency on-chain).
params._tokenHolder: The account whose tokens will be redeemed.
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens need to be redeemed.

controllerTransfer(address,address,uint2.details: This function can only be executed by the `controller` address.

params._data: data to validate the transfer. (It is not used in this reference implementation because use of `_data` parameter is implementation specific).
params._from: Address The address which you want to send tokens from
params._operatorData: data attached to the transfer by controller to emit in event. (It is more like a reason string for calling this function (aka force transfer) which provides the transparency on-chain).
params._to: Address The address which you want to transfer to
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

decimals().details: Get the number of decimals of the token.

returns._0: The number of decimals of the token. For retrocompatibility, decimals are forced to 18 in ERC1400.
string The URI associated with the document.
returns._1: bytes32 The hash (of the contents) of the document.

isControllable().details: If `isControllable` returns `false` then it always return `false` and `controllerTransfer` / `controllerRedeem` will always revert.

returns._0: bool `true` when controller address is non-zero otherwise return `false`.

isIssuable().details: Know if new tokens can be issued in the future. If a token returns FALSE for `isIssuable()` then it MUST never allow additional tokens to be issued.

returns._0: bool 'true' if tokens can still be issued by the issuer, 'false' if they can't anymore.

params.data: Information attached to the issuance, by the issuer.
params.tokenHolder: Address for which we want to issue tokens.

redeem(uint256,bytes).details: Redeem the amount of tokens from the address 'msg.sender'.

params.data: Information attached to the redemption, by the token holder.

redeemFrom(address,uint256,bytes).details: Redeem the amount of tokens on behalf of the address from.

params.from: Token holder whose tokens will be redeemed (or address(0) to set from to msg.sender).

removeDocument(bytes32).details: Can only be executed by the owner of the contract.

params.name: Name of the document. It should be unique always

setDocument(bytes32,string,bytes32).details: Can only be executed by the owner of the contract.

params.documentHash: hash (of the contents) of the document.
params.documentUri: Off-chain uri of the document from where it is accessible to investors/advisors to read.
params.name: Name of the document. It should be unique always

totalSupply().details: Total number of tokens in existence

transfer(address,uint256).details: Transfer token for a specified address

returns._0: A boolean that indicates if the operation was successful.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfer tokens from one address to another

params.from: address The address which you want to send tokens from
params.to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params.value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

transferFromWithData(address,address,uin.details: Transfer the amount of tokens on behalf of the address 'from' to the address 'to'.

params.data: Information attached to the transfer, and intended for the token holder ('from').
params.from: Token holder (or 'address(0)' to set from to 'msg.sender').

transferWithData(address,uint256,bytes).details: Transfer the amount of tokens from the address 'msg.sender' to the address 'to'.

params.data: Information attached to the transfer, by the token holder.

controllerRedeem(address,uint256,bytes,b.notice: This function allows an authorised address to redeem tokens for any token holder. The redemption must still respect the balances of the token holder (so the redemption must be for at most `balanceOf(_tokenHolder)` tokens) and potentially also need to respect other transfer restrictions.

controllerTransfer(address,address,uint2.notice: This function allows an authorised address to transfer tokens between any two token holders. The transfer must still respect the balances of the token holders (so the transfer must be for at most `balanceOf(_from)` tokens) and potentially also need to respect other transfer restrictions.

getDocument(bytes32).notice: Used to return the details of a document with a known name (`bytes32`).

isControllable().notice: In order to provide transparency over whether `controllerTransfer` / `controllerRedeem` are useable or not `isControllable` function will be used.

removeDocument(bytes32).notice: Used to remove an existing document from the contract by giving the name of the document.

setDocument(bytes32,string,bytes32).notice: Used to attach a new document to the contract, or update the URI or hash of an existing attached document
